entry.title: Re: sap calm custom fields
entry.content:
Hi @jerrysam 

Yes, in SAP Cloud Application Lifecycle Management you can create custom fields for objects such as Requirements, Tasks, Test Cases, Defects, and Features, but there are some constraints compared to on-premise ALM.

Here are current Capabilities

  • Custom Fields & Logic app is not available in Cloud ALM it is only in S/4HANA.
  • Instead, Cloud ALM has its own In App Extensibility for certain work items.
  • For Requirements, Tasks, Test Cases, User Stories, and Features, you can:
    • Add Custom Fields via Administration тЖТ Custom Fields.
    • Decide where they are visible for example in details UI, filters, reports.
    • Use them for tracking, filtering, and reporting.

Here are steps to achieve that

  1. Go to Cloud ALM тЖТ Administration тЖТ Custom Fields.
  2. Select the Entity Type like Requirement, Task, Test Case, etc.
  3. Create a new Custom Field.
  4. Assign it to the relevant UI.
  5. Save and activate тЖТ The field is now available for project teams.

 

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

Custom Fields in SAP Cloud ALM

Extending SAP Cloud ALM with Custom Fields

entry.title: Efficient Data Management: Data Governance APJ
entry.content:
Join SAP experts and fellow customers to explore steps for establishing robust data governance that transforms data into a strategic assetтАФdriving smarter decisions and enabling growth through big data. 

Register Here

Details

 

Steps to establish robust data governance to maximize the value of data as a strategic asset, driving better decision-making and leveraging big data for organizational growth and success

 

Overview

Managing a data governance framework can feel like taming an unruly beast. Multiple data sources, siloed teams, and unclear governance lead to confusion and risks. Take back control with proven Data Governance Transformation Programs. Introducing 1:Few Sessions for SAP SuccessFactors customers.

In this interactive webinar, Data Governance SAP expert and Transformation Advisor Nicole Wright will share real-world examples and leading practices, providing an opportunity for customers to collaborate, share insights, and learn from colleagues in other organizations.

Each month we will alternate with the two topics 

Introduction of Data Governance

Introduction to HR Data Catalog

 

Why should you attend?

 

In these interactive sessions, SAP SuccessFactors customers will network and gain insights to tame their data governance frameworks. Attendees will also have the opportunity to exchange ideas and experiences in an open peer-to-peer format, strengthening their ability to manage data as a strategic asset and ensure compliance, security, and accuracy across their HR tech ecosystems.

 

We will talk about:

Relevant programs to be successful at your transformation

тАвData Management Strategy

тАвData Governance

тАвData Governance Charter

тАвOperating Framework and Responsibilities

тАвPlan for Operational Success and HR Data Catalogue

тАвHR Data Governance

тАвData Governance Roadmap

тАвData Governance and AI

entry.title: Efficient Data Management: Data Catalogue APJ
entry.content:
Join SAP experts and fellow customers to explore steps for establishing robust data governance that transforms data into a strategic assetтАФdriving smarter decisions and enabling growth through big data. 

Register Here

Details

 

Steps to establish robust data governance to maximize the value of data as a strategic asset, driving better decision-making and leveraging big data for organizational growth and success

 

Overview

Managing a data governance framework can feel like taming an unruly beast. Multiple data sources, siloed teams, and unclear governance lead to confusion and risks. Take back control with proven Data Governance Transformation Programs. Introducing 1:Few Sessions for SAP SuccessFactors customers.

In this interactive webinar,  Data Governance SAP expert and Transformation Advisor Nicole Wright will share real-world examples and leading practices, providing an opportunity for customers to collaborate, share insights, and learn from colleagues in other organizations.

Each month we will alternate with the two topics 

Introduction of Data Governance

Introduction to HR Data Catalog

 

Why should you attend?

 

In these interactive sessions, SAP SuccessFactors customers will network and gain insights to tame their data governance frameworks. Attendees will also have the opportunity to exchange ideas and experiences in an open peer-to-peer format, strengthening their ability to manage data as a strategic asset and ensure compliance, security, and accuracy across their HR tech ecosystems.

 

We will talk about:

Relevant programs to be successful at your transformation

тАвData Management Strategy

тАвData Governance

тАвData Governance Charter

тАвOperating Framework and Responsibilities

тАвPlan for Operational Success and HR Data Catalogue

тАвHR Data Governance

тАвData Governance Roadmap

тАвData Governance and AI

entry.title: Re: Visibility of data submitted with guest interaction
entry.content:
Hi Wittek,

If OTP verification is required, e.g. the submitted data is not allowed by the guest schema, the data is not stored anywhere until the user verify his email.

Note that unauthenticated interaction can be done when the account already exist and it can override existing data, hence this verification must happen before the account being updated.

entry.title: Re: Fiori - supplier Evaluation - No data available
entry.content:
Hi @Mahil @APY 

Hope the following will help you solve the issue. Thank you @APY  for raising it again.

The Fiori apps F1663A , F1661A , F1664A , and F2019 are analytical apps that rely on pre-delivered CDS Views and Analytical Queries.

When these apps show No data available, even after OData activation, it typically means that the underlying data sources are not filled or activated correctly.

 

Here are potential root Causes to Check:

  1. Analytical Query Activation
    • These apps run on CDS-based analytical queries for example C_SALESORDERITEMQRY, C_SALESDOCUMENTITEMQRY.
    • Please ensure that your queries are activated and released in your Public Cloud system.
    • In Public Cloud, this is done via delivered scope items. Make sure the correct Sales Analytics scope items for example 1S0, 2AN, 2QV, etc. are activated in your system.
  2. Business Roles & Authorizations
    • Check that your user has the right Business Catalogs:
      • SAP_SD_BCR_FIELDSALESREP_PC
      • SAP_SD_BCR_SALESANALYST_PC
    • Missing catalogs means the queries will run but return empty results due to restrictions.
  3. Underlying Transaction Data
    • These reports pull data from Sales Orders, Deliveries, Returns etc.
    • If your system only has customizing and no actual business documents such as SO, DN and Returns, then the queries will correctly return No Data.
  4. OData Service Binding
    • OData services like C_SALESORDERITEM_CDS must be active.
    • In Public Cloud, this is normally pre-delivered and auto activated but double check in the Communication Arrangement for Analytics.

 

Here is how you can resolve it:

First thing is to verify Scope Items. Make sure to check in Manage Your Solution app that Analytics for Sales (2AN) or relevant best practices are active.

Then test Queries Directly. Open app View Browser тЖТ Search for C_SALESORDERITEMQRY and run it directly if no data, the issue is not with the Fiori app but with missing analytics activation or no transactions.

Finally create Sample Data. Make sure to create a test Sales Order and Delivery тЖТ then rerun the app. If data now appears, it confirms the earlier runs were empty due to no transactional data.

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Migration to SAP S/4HANA: What happens to VKM5?
entry.content: I have reviewed the content from the provided links and also the SAP Note, but it is still not completely clear whether VKM5 will become obsolete in S/4HANA. The development I am planning involves checking the customerтАЩs credit limit through an external system via API at the moment of delivery creation. If no limit is available, the delivery should remain blocked in VKM5. If the VKM5 transaction is indeed going to be deprecated in S/4HANA, then my alternative approach would be to create a custom monitor. In this case, after consulting the external system, if there is no credit limit, the delivery would be blocked for billing through this new monitor instead.

entry.title: Re: Hierarchy totals agreggation display
entry.content:
Hi @Joao_Costa 

What you are describing is a planning aggregation problem: you want the year total to remain fixed at 0.20 even if monthly values do not add up for example Jan = 0.40 but year total should still stay 0.20.

 

Here is a Standard IBP Behaviour

  • By default, totals equal sum of child values for example Year equals sum of Months.
  • This ensures data consistency across levels.
  • Out of the box, you cannot break the additivity rule.

 

Here are potential options to Achieve your Requirement

  1. Key Figure with Exception Aggregation for Static Total
    • Create a new key figure that:
      • Has exception aggregation = Last Value or Fixed Value at Year level.
      • At month level, it stores your planning values.
      • At year level, it ignores the sum and instead displays a fixed total, in this case 0.20.
    • This way, Year total will always show 0.20, regardless of monthly entries.
  2. Disaggregation Setting
    • Set disaggregation so that when you change the Year, it spreads proportionally to months.
    • But in your case, you want the reverse to keep Year fixed while months deviate.
    • The suggested solution is, disable disaggregation for the Year level in this key figure тЖТ Year stays static, months editable.
  3. Using Helper Key Figures
    • Here is the designated approach:
      • Key Figure A = Planned Monthly editable Values.
      • Key Figure B = Fixed Year Total which remains always 0.20, not additive.
      • Key Figure C = Reporting view that combines A monthly with B year.
    • This gives flexibility to plan freely in months but display a static year cap.
  4. Using Custom Business Rule
    • Use Planning Operators or a custom script in Advanced Planning to overwrite the Year total after each save. For example: after planning, force Year = 0.20.

 

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

 

Aggregation and Exception Aggregation

Planning View Behaviour in IBP

entry.title: Lead in the Age of AI, Start with Your Data
entry.content:
At a Glance: Lead in the Age of AI, Start with Your Data  

AI is only as powerful as the data it runs on. Inaccurate context, broken semantics, or outdated master data can turn automation from an advantage into a riskтАФcosting companies millions each year in delays, errors, and lost trust.  

SAP Business Data Cloud provides a trusted data foundation by preserving semantics, logic, and context of your data. This eliminates manual data work, accelerates decision-making, and enables CFOs, COOs, and CIOs to act on accurate, contextual data.

Leading companies are already replacing manual workarounds with reusable data products, harmonized KPIs, and automated reconciliations. Join our hands-on webinar series to see how you can unleash speed, trust, and impact with SAP Business Data Cloud.

Learn more:Getting Started Series: Experience SAP Business Data Cloud

Full article: Lead in the Age of AI, Start with Your Data
Imagine an AI that automatically optimizes pricing to clear inventory while protecting marginsтАФwithout human input. Now imagine that AI running on inaccurate data: the wrong currency, outdated master data, or misaligned cost centers. Suddenly, automation isnтАЩt an advantageтАФitтАЩs a risk. 

This is why data can no longer be treated as a back-office IT assetтАФitтАЩs a strategic business capability. The companies leading in AI arenтАЩt the ones with the most data, but the ones with the right data, at the right time, with the right context. 

When Poor Data Foundations Impact the Bottom Line  

According to Forrester, poor data quality costs organizations over $5 million annually. Even more alarming, 7% report losses of $25 million or more (Forrester, 2024). Gartner research reinforces this reality.  In a 2020 study, Gartner found that poor data quality costs organizations an average of $12.9 million annually (Gartner 2020).  

ItтАЩs rarely the volume of data that slows organizations downтАФitтАЩs the lack of business context. Poorly managed master data, disconnected hierarchies, missing lineage, and duplicated logic all contribute to fragmented views that undermine trust, delay decisions, and increase cost. 

The typical workaround? Manual fixes: recreating data context, writing custom scripts, and rebuilding SAPтАЩs logic in other tools. These solutions are often fragile, expensive, manual and error prone. When systems change or org structures realign, the fixes can breakтАФand IT has a new project all over again. 

The result: every decision takes longer, and every delay carries a cost. 

The consequences are real: 

  • Product profitability becomes unreliable if cost and pricing data use different hierarchies 
  • Regional forecasting fails when customer hierarchies are inconsistent 
  • KPIs vary between teams because each is working with different assumptions 

The impact on business leaders: 

  • CFOs risk inaccurate forecasts, delayed closes, and loss in profits 
  • COOs waste time waiting on reconciling reports instead of driving execution 
  • CIOs / CDOs see mounting costs as teams duplicate work, rebuild logic, and rely on shadow systems 

Leading companies are changing courseтАФnot by rebuilding data outside SAP, but by activating the trusted business logic already in place. 

Unleash Speed, Trust, and Impact with SAP Business Data Cloud  

SAP Business Data Cloud helps organizations turn fragmented data into a trusted foundation for decision-making. By unifying data across systems and preserving the business context that gives it meaning it significantly reduces the need for manual reconciliation or reengineering.  

The result is now reversed because the data is accurate, and actionable, enabling faster execution, stronger alignment, and higher return on data investments. 

How SAP Business Data Cloud strengthens enterprise data foundations: 

  • Preserve context natively: context, semantics, logic, and hierarchies stay intactтАФno rework needed. 
  • Deliver trusted, reusable data products: Instead of manually preparing data for every model or report, teams can access governed, curated assets that reflect real business truth. 
  • Empower intelligent applications: With high-quality, harmonized data at their core, applications for planning, forecasting, sustainability, and operations drive insights where decisions happen real timeтАФnot after the fact. 

Customer Transformation in Action 
Discover how leading organizations are transforming their business with trusted data. HereтАЩs a collection of customer testimonials showcasing how SAP helps companies tackle opportunities across industriesтАФwhether through modernization, real-time decision-making, or unlocking new growth powered by SAP Business Data Cloud. 

SAP Featured Stories for Business Data Cloud 

Experience SAP Business Data Cloud First-Hand:
To experience the power of SAP Business Data Cloud, join a hands-on webinar series designed to accelerate data strategies. Across a series of interactive modules, here SAPтАЩs product and leadership teams guide participants through practical steps to unlock business value from their data.  

Topics include:  

  • Build and simulate outcomes with Intelligent Applications 
  • Accelerate AI innovation with SAP Databricks 
  • Create analytical models and data products in SAP Datasphere

This is your chance to learn directly from some of the industry experts on how to turn your data into a true business driver.

Learn more: Getting Started Series: Experience SAP Business Data Cloud

entry.title: Re: Business Partner Relationship WebService Inbound
entry.content:
Hello @Simon 

Thank you for the question and the screenshot. It is helpful.

The root cause seems to be that the relationship message canтАЩt locate one or both partners in the key-mapping table, which leads to a failed lookup by Externalid. This results in the message: Unknown Business Partners / ID and UUID тАж missing.

What you should do

  1. Create both BPs initially through the BP inbound service using ExternalID and the same BusinessSystemID (your Salesforce logical system). Wait for successful creation, so key mappings are in place.
  2. Do not include Internalids in the relationship payload. Only send ExternalIDs along with BusinessSystemID for both parties.
  3.  Ensure that the BusinessSystemID / SenderBusinessSystemID in the relationship message exactly matches what you used for the BP creates, keeping in mind case sensitivity
  4. If the contact might not exist yet, wait to queue or retry the relationship until after the BP-create confirmation, or use InternalIDs if they are already available.

Minimal relationship references

<InitiatingBusinessPartner>

  <BusinessPartnerExternalID>SF-ACCOUNT-ID</BusinessPartnerExternalID>

  <BusinessSystemID>SALESFORCE</BusinessSystemID>

</InitiatingBusinessPartner>

<RelatedBusinessPartner>

  <BusinessPartnerExternalID>SF-CONTACT-ID</BusinessPartnerExternalID>

  <BusinessSystemID>SALESFORCE</BusinessSystemID>

</RelatedBusinessPartner>

<!-- + your RelationshipCategoryCode and Validity -->

Just make sure both mappings are in place and that you're referencing them using ExternalID along with the system ID.

Please feel free to use these official references for your work.:

  • Your exact error ID and UUID of Business Partner is missingтАЭ / тАЬUnknown Business Partners тАж for relation when the partner canтАЩt be resolved from key-mapping during relationship replication. (KBA; may require S-user) SAP Support Portal
  • Business Partner Integration (SAP_COM_0008) in S/4HANA Cloud; includes relationships. SAP Help Portal
  • SOAP (Simple Object Access Protocol) inbound BP replicate service: BusinessPartnerSUITEBulkReplicateRequest_In on API Hub for S/4HANA Cloud. SAP Business Accelerator Hub
  • SOAP inbound BP relationship service: BusinessPartnerRelationshipSUITEBulkReplicateRequest_In (used in Cloud). SAP Business Accelerator Hub
  • Manage Key Mapping app in S/4HANA Cloud (to see/maintain mappings used by the lookup). SAP Help Portal
  • BusinessPartnerRelationship concept page in the Cloud help.

Let me know if it works

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Date Governance - Introduction of Data Governance (APJ)
entry.content:
Steps to establish robust data governance to maximize the value of data as a strategic asset, driving better decision-making and leveraging big data for organizational growth and success.

Register Here

Overview

Managing a data governance framework can feel like taming an unruly beast. Multiple data sources, siloed teams, and unclear governance lead to confusion and risks. Take back control with proven Data Governance Transformation Programs. Introducing 1:Few Sessions for SAP SuccessFactors customers.

In this interactive webinar,  Data Governance SAP expert and Transformation Advisor Nicole Wright will share real-world examples and leading practices, providing an opportunity for customers to collaborate, share insights, and learn from colleagues in other organizations.

Each month we will alternate with the two topics 

Introduction of Data Governance

Introduction to HR Data Catalog

 

Why should you attend?

 

In these interactive sessions, SAP SuccessFactors customers will network and gain insights to tame their data governance frameworks. Attendees will also have the opportunity to exchange ideas and experiences in an open peer-to-peer format, strengthening their ability to manage data as a strategic asset and ensure compliance, security, and accuracy across their HR tech ecosystems.

 

We will talk about:

Relevant programs to be successful at your transformation

тАвData Management Strategy

тАвData Governance

тАвData Governance Charter

тАвOperating Framework and Responsibilities

тАвPlan for Operational Success and HR Data Catalogue

тАвHR Data Governance

тАвData Governance Roadmap

тАвData Governance and AI

entry.title: Re: Change Image and Description in Award Details Page
entry.content: First navigate to the Spot Awards menu and choose the plan you want to edit.   Then navigate to Categories/Levels and from there you will be able to edit the description and upload an image to the corresponding levels or categories.  I attached an image of the categories but the levels are just below when you scroll.
